Member Function Documentation

dbms_unsigned_int32 mc_dbms_segment::get_number (   )  const [inline]
 

This returns the segment number of the segment it is called on.

Returns:
An integer representing the segment's segment number.

static mc_dbms_segment* const mc_dbms_segment::get_segment (   )  [inline, static]
 

In our implementation there is only one persistent segment (it is static).

Returns:
The persistent segment.

static mc_dbms_segment* const mc_dbms_segment::get_transient_segment (   )  [inline, static]
 

This returns the transient segment. In our implementation there is only 1 transient segment (it is static).

Returns:
The transient segment.

dbms_boolean mc_dbms_segment::is_deleted (   )  [inline]
 

This tells whether the segment has been deleted or not.

Returns:
A boolean of 0 if the segment has not been deleted, 1 if it has

dbms_boolean mc_dbms_segment::is_empty (   )  [inline]
 

This tells whether the segment is empty or not.

Returns:
A boolean of 0 if the segment is not empty, 1 if it is.

dbms_boolean mc_dbms_segment::is_transient_segment (   )  [inline]
 

Returns:
Return true if this is a transient segment and false if it is not.

const dbms_unsigned_int32 mc_dbms_segment::m_seg_number [static, private]
 

In this implementation there is only one segment (so this value is constant).

We only use one persistent segment.

We only use one transient segment.
